This role will be based in our Adelaide Head Office but may be required to be based on Project sites around South Australia.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Position\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The nature of the role requires close and regular interaction with Operations and Engineering staff across multiple project sites. Perform and coordinate the daily tracking of project data (i.e. plant, labour, subcontractors). This requires you to monitor and maintain the Company’s in-house project management &amp; docket system.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support payroll by monitoring and follow up The position can be either local to Warwick, QLD or drive in, drive out on a 10\u002F4 roster. Reporting to the Senior Safety Advisor, this role is responsible for ensuring that operations are carried out safely and with consideration of environmental protection and ensuring that the project is aware of and complies with all legislation in relation to the use of its plant and equipment as well as workplace activities and that the project meets its statutory and industry obligations in respect to Industrial and safety matters at all times.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Key accountabilities include, but are not limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Co-ordinates responsibilities and to improve their capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Resolves issues that may arise in respect of Health and Safety<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Records and assists in the investigation of accidents and dangerous occurrences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assists with audits of suppliers and subcontractors in the field to improve and maintain a heightened level of safety<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all workers have received a project specific induction that explains all hazards present on the project and the control measures to be followed before beginning working activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote and lead by example, the project commitment to a safety culture that will achieve an incident and injury free workplace<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Routinely engage workers at all levels in discussions aimed at gaining commitment to safe behaviour<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adopt a zero tolerance to work practices and equipment that may be unsafe or have serious adverse Safety or environmental impact<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Becomes familiar with current knowledge of the latest plant, equipment, materials and construction techniques relevant to the project at hand including availability and costs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support General Foreman, Foreman and site workers to eliminate or minimize hazards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist in the reporting, investigation and suggestion of corrective and\u002For preventive actions resulting from identification of hazards, near miss incidents and work related illness\u002Finjury<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report on health, safety and environmental matters Are you a passionate individual who wants to make a difference, promote sustainable development, and find solutions to the biggest global challenges including climate change, overpopulation, and water scarcity? Come and join us in building the infrastructure our planet needs to achieve a sustainable future.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> We currently have a new permanent opportunity for a Finance Administrator to come and join our team! Come and join Acciona at this exciting chapter of growth.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          Job Description\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Finance Administrator reports to the Alliance Financial Controller and is responsible for ensuring all commercial and administrative aspects of Project Management are conducted in an efficient and timely manner, and with a high level of accuracy. This role will be based full time out of our Chelsea Heights Project Office. Own Transport required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Benefits\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Opportunities for progression and professional development\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Join a leader in sustainability and help to build a better world\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Be part of SPA – a highly successful alliance with a strong track record of delivery\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Competitive salary in line with experience + discretionary bonus + salary sacrifice options\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Inclusive, diverse and team orientated team culture\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Position\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The nature of the role requires close and regular interaction with Operations and Engineering staff across multiple project sites. So, building a rapport with our project delivery teams is key.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform and coordinate the daily tracking of project performance data (i.e. plant, labor, subcontractors and suppliers). This requires you to monitor and audit multiple projects in the Alliance and\u002For Company’s in-house project management system, providing a daily report to the Operations Manager on any missing data\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     High volume accounts payable with our numerous suppliers\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Monitor and follow up on the daily recording of timesheet data by field staff, as well as directly performing timesheet entry (for importation into Payroll) in some circumstances\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Obtain “New Project Start” forms from Engineers, set up the new job and enter the budget in our job costing, contract management and financial accounting system, and issue Bank Guarantees where required\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Control the Bank Guarantee (BG) process, which includes the following tasks: liaise with the bank to issue BGs; issue BGs to Clients; maintain a BG register and reconcile to bank listing each month; and chase overdue unconditional BGs\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Control the revenue process mid-month, reporting to the Financial Controller at month-end. This requires you to:\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Liaise with Engineers to ensure that all progress claims and variations are entered into our financial accounting system on a timely basis, entering them yourself as required\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain an uncertified claims file and list, to be presented to the Financial Controller at month-end for posting to the General Ledger.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          Required Skills and Competencies\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experienced in high volume accounts payable and able to learn our inhouse finance systems (Training provided)\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experienced dealing with a large volume of suppliers and being able to build and maintain relationships\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Able to adapt, solve problems and be a team player contributing to a positive work culture\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must have own transport\u002FCurrent drivers license\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #LI-LG1\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <i> ACCIONA has been given the Top Employer 2022 certification in Australia, which certifies the company's commitment to excellence in human resources management and those who focus on putting their people first through their exceptional HR policies. <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. the construction and operational areas.\n <br> \n <br> This role will facilitate the best possible outcome with respect to cost, time, safety and quality, as well as enabling cooperation and You will report to the Survey Manager and will have an opportunity to manage other surveyors and be a part of a successful surveying team, that delivers a wide scope of survey information. Based in the CBD office intiialy but moving out to site as required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Project\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Acciona, MACA, AECOM Alliance has been selected as the preferred bidder on the northern package of the North East Link. This covers design and construction between the M80-Plenty Road interchange and the north tunnel entrance at Watsonia. Works include three kilometers of new freeway, two kilometers of new freeway upgrades, construction of retaining walls and bridge structures, rail interface works, intelligent transport systems, and urban design and landscaping. This diverse and challenging project will be complete in 2028.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Key accountabilities for the position\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support management and coordination of (internal and external) survey resources to meet the project requirements\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Proactively develop survey strategies and approved implementation for achieving project survey requirements\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Establishing and maintaining survey procedures, equipment, software, models, and controls throughout the project that are necessary to meet the project survey requirements\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Manage and update survey master files including feature surveys, as-builts and utilities for the dissemination of required survey data into project specific workflows. <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> The Environment Compliance Coordinator will be responsible for driving, managing and implementing permitting\u002Fapproval obligations to ensure project compliance for projects in the development, pre-construction, construction and operational phases. stages - preconstruction, construction and operational phases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provision of advice to project managers, construction and operation managers on environmental and planning related issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand and drive the implementation of compliance obligations (EPBC, permit\u002Fapproval, management plans, environment regulations etc) during construction and operational phases.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development of environmental programs and any training necessary at construction and operating sites.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake site audits during construction and operational phases, prepare audit reports and ensure action items are followed up<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reviewing and follow up actions from external audit reports.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of environmental issues as they emerge with the appropriate internal or external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading the development and maintenance of relationships with stakeholders including local, state and federal Government staff and local community representatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitoring of developments in planning and environmental legislation and regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Desirable to have environmental compliance experience in Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Desirable to have experiences\u002Fexposure to wind farm noise compliance requirements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Environmental Management\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assistance in the preparation of environmental management plans (EMPs).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be responsible for ongoing operational compliance requirements including updating and re-endorsement of management plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Engagement and management of specialist consultants to prepare cultural heritage management plans, landscaping plans, pest plant &amp; animal control plans, avifauna monitoring plans, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination and delivery of allocated deliverables on time and within budget.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of secondary consents including endorsement of plans, management plans and documents prior to construction, You will take reasonability for leading and developing your team focusing on ensuring the timely handover of the electrical and mechanical systems from Construction to Commissioning.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> You will take ownership across the following areas:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Coordinating and administering all completion activities, including ITR management, punch-listing, walkdowns and Turn Over Pack (TOP) collation, to ensure plant process systems are ready to hand over in accordance with contracts, designs and specifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liaise with the Construction, Commissioning and Project Control Teams and other stakeholders on priorities and ensure Completions activities align to the Project Schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify and forecast risks and opportunities for the project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide positive team leadership and commitment to Health &amp; <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> As we grow our business, opportunities to be part of this growth continue. <div>\n  ACCIONA Energy is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energy offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energy is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv> As ACCIONA Energia continues to expand, so does our need for expertise. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. The Cost Controller will maintain, monitor and improve the systems which will ensure costs and forecasts are accurately known and controlled.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support development of standard cost control procedures, guidelines, templates, coding etc. to allow consistent cost management and reporting across the cost control team and support compliance to the standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Utilise standard cost control procedures and processes including WBS, monthly report, change control, management of budgets, forecasting, financial support relating to contract administration and project cost close out to help ensure a consistent approach across a portfolio of projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist in providing the provision of adequate information flow to the Manager, Project Controls around budgets, expenditure, forecasts and progress to accommodate decision making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development, tender evaluation, contractor change assessment and contract financial close out<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce monthly tracking information against budget to meet Finance Team requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Apply earned value management tools and techniques to interpret data and provide timely insight and recommendations on project and program performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure compliance with Project Finance requirements to provide accurate, timely, quality accrual, cost and claim management processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and investigate unusual trends in cost codes, dockets and invoices to determine if cost codes are up to date and correct<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monthly analysis of costs codes, actuals and accruals, in the lead up to the end of month closure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor and report on project status, expenditure versus budget, forecast to complete, schedule updates and progress against baselines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive cost &amp; estimate risk analysis sessions as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review costs spent to date vs contracted amount<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report on payments on time and\u002For ABCC Reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop knowledge in using SEO and SAP software<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          Required Skills and Competencies\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce\u002FBusiness (or similar)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 5 years’ experience in a Cost Controller position or similar in a construction project setting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Track record of implementing cost control systems and procedures in large infrastructure projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience analysing high volume data sets<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #LI-MA1\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <i> ACCIONA has been given the Top Employer 2022 certification in Australia, which certifies the company's commitment to excellence in human resources management and those who focus on putting their people first through their exceptional HR policies. Works include 2km of new freeway upgrade, 3km of new freeway, separation of local roads from the freeways, almost 2M.m3 of earthworks, retaining walls, bridge structures, rail interface works, intelligent transport systems, urban design, and landscaping. This diverse and challenging project will be completed by late 2028.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The North East Link (NEL) will provide a safe and efficient freeway connection for more than 135,000 vehicles a day, taking 15,000 trucks off busy residential roads in the north east of greater Melbourne each day and reducing traffic on the arterial road network crossing the Yarra River by 50,000 vehicles per day. It will also enhance access to major suburban business and employment centres, improve orbital road connectivity across Melbourne and boost the capacity of the city’s freight network. We will also be proudly setting the standards for environmental and sustainability at all stages of the project in line with the Acciona Sustainability Management Plan (SMP-2025).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> After a recent promotion, an opportunity has now opened up for a Site Coordinator to provide support and administration at our Mt Gellibrand Wind Farm.\n <br> \n <br> This role is designed to provide administrative support for wind farm activities and support the Site Manager with ACCIONA Energy’s HSEQ, risk and compliance requirements, Operational Excellence, document management, reporting, community relations activities and landowner inquiries.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <div>\n          <div>\n           <div>\n            <div>\n administration support to Site Manager and site team and general support for wind farm projects, programs and strategic initiatives and other operational priorities as required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> General office administrative assistance including photocopying, filing, document collation, archiving, data entry and any other tasks required to support the Site Manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Document minutes for site meetings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist the Site Manager in the completion of reports KPIs, monitoring performance.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist to maintain site specific documents, policies and procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and process invoices for payment in line with the company finance and procurement systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communication, consultation and coordination of site activities with contractors and visitors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain accuracy and currency of renewable energy sites’ registers and records.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain site related Maximo system requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist the Site Manager in the daily management of the sites’ operational activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain and monitor training and competencies and liase with HR to ensure reporting and adherence accuracy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Key contact point for various corporate office functions including, corporate services, HSEQ, HR, Brand and Marketing.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Health and Safety\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support the Site Manager and the HSEQ team in promoting a strong HSEQ working culture within the team and be an active member of the HSEQ Committee.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive the utilization and performance of the Integrated Management System or ‘IMS’ including reviewing, maintaining and closing out actions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conduct, facilitate and provide support for systematic hazard identification, risk assessments and recommend risk reductions, JSEA and SWMS.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report on monthly and ad hoc HSEQ performance across the site, including contractors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organise site HSEQ system documents and procedures for AEAG staff and contractors in line with IMS corporate guidance and consultation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide monitoring and documenting authorizations, induction and training programs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the contractor induction process and utilise the associated systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Operational Excellence\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support the site to achieve the Operational Excellence Program KPI’s and to ensure high efficiency of labour relating to turbines &amp; substation works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the site to ensure the reporting systems are accurately recording the work completed and work pending through the Operational Excellence program.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Community and Landowner Relations\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support Acciona community events and wind farm visits by third parties.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide support to ensure positive relationships with local communities and key stakeholders and liaise with the <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> This role is responsible for leading the Acciona Energia’s Electrical Engineering Team. The role will provide both people and technical leadership to the electrical engineering function in supporting the business’ delivery of renewable energy projects through all phases including early prospection, construction, and operations. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Engineering, this role is primarily office based in Melbourne with occasional travel to construction, operational and development sites.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n priorities in a fast paced and dynamic environment to ensure business objectives are met<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mentoring and development of team members to build the team’s long-term capability and capacity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Informed decision making on technical matters based on recommendations from the team’s technical experts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous improvement of team’s processes and procedures<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Development Projects\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Early project phase network connection feasibility assessments, design optioneering studies, value engineering, risks, safety (including Safety in Design)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work collaboratively with grid connection team to develop of electrical balance of plant design solutions that support the project’s NER compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Engagement with TNSPs and private grid network operators to confirm physical connection constraints and requirements for development projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of concept and detailed design delivery for primary, secondary and SCADA system designs for primarily wind farms, solar farms and BESS projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in project constructability reviews including site based and desktop assessments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring team’s compliant review (and in some cases formal approval), of primary, secondary and SCADA system designs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage the team’s engagement with the wind farm, solar farm, and BESS OEMs to define project SCADA system architecture and performance requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support project CAPEX and construction schedule development for project financial investment decisions<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Construction Projects\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Perform engineering due diligence reviews and design management for design works outsourced to external consultants\u002Fcontractors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop contract technical specifications and scopes of work and assist with the negotiation of procurement agreements for electrical design and construction works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide support to the Project Delivery Teams through the construction and handover phases. Support requirements including responding to construction RFIs, resolution of design implementation issues. Occasional site visit will be required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate the team’s support of the Project Delivery Team with the onsite project energization and commissioning process including SCADA, protection systems commissioning, and NER hold point testing<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Operations\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide technical advice on electrical engineering failures or incidents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide technical advice for upgrades or modifications to operational infrastructure.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop contract technical specifications and scopes of works as required to support operation phase rectification works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide commissioning support to the operations team for system upgrades when required<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   General\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide professional electrical engineering advice regarding in-house developments, bids and delivery of third-party Engineering, Procurement and Construction projects and operational assets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist in the development of tender documents for submission of external bids and other contracting opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain strong working relationships with head-office, internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain and improve the technical standards and company The scale of the MacIntyre project makes it one of the largest onshore wind farms in the world today.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   ACCIONA are seeking to engage an Electrical Site Engineer for our Macintyre Windfarm project in QLD. This position can be either local to Warwick, QLD or drive in, drive out on a 10\u002F4 roster. Reporting to the Project Engineer, these roles have primary responsibility for ensuring the effective coordination and control of Engineering Works for a designated Project through activities of technical, engineering, inspection, scheduling, planning, survey, procurement and quality control based on ACCIONA standards; and facilitating effective communication and coordination between all disciplines and all other project activities relevant to work crew.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Key accountabilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Collaborate in defining work methods, techniques, and tools to improve the project’s quality, timelines, and costs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates fundamental systems, equipment, products and tools that support the production of projects and services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain daily site diary of all activities in your work area<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that program is communicated to subcontractors, suppliers and internal staff<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conduct tender interviews, assess and evaluate subcontractor submissions and perform evaluation and expenditure approval for engagement of subcontractors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide feedback to subcontractors on submission and reason for loss\u002Faward of tender<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conduct subcontractor start up, weekly meetings and manage all conformance to contract terms and conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all contractual requirements are met, including making recommendation to the Construction Manager for award of practical completion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Control schedule and all inputs and outputs for the management of an area of work. Implement prompt corrective action and reporting if targets are not being achieved.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage design of temporary works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Obtain necessary reviews, approvals and certifications, ensure third party sign off or independent verification of temporary works design<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          Required Skills and Competencies\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering with proven experience on Major Construction Projects in the capacity of Electrical Site Engineer. Knowledge of engineering project management principles with an in-depth understanding of engineering and site management principles will be essential for this role, as will having a collaborative and innovative approach to solving challenges.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to apply\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> All applications need to be submitted formally and all the pre-screening questions answered.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To be eligible for consideration all applicants must be an Australian Citizen \u002F Australian Permanent Resident \u002F New Zealand Citizen or hold appropriate work rights to work in Australia and be willing to undertake the necessary pre-employment checks which could include a Medical and a National Police Check.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Applications via Agency Recruiters will not be accepted.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <i> ACCIONA has been given the Top Employer 2022 certification in Australia, which certifies the company's commitment to excellence in human resources management and those who focus on putting their people first through their exceptional HR policies. The Commissioning Engineer ensures that contractual profitability and obligations are met and maintained.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will take ownership across the following areas:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Development of inspection test reports (ITR) and supporting completion management system in gathering electrical data for uploading.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Development of switching program for high and low voltage systems.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Preparation of detail schedule for electrical system, look ahead plan, manhours estimation for electrical scope of work.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Day to Day coordination with commissioning E&amp;I subcontractors, Grid operator, for establishing power supply from Grid in commissioning stage and synchronization in start-up phase.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinating and maintaining electrical Isolation registers (HV, LV, Boundary) and review notice of energisation, electrical PTW requests and SIMOPS events.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Providing support to other system engineers in preparation and execution phases.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensuring that the highest standards of health, safety &amp; environmental management are implemented; and ensure compliance with regulatory and licensing requirement regarding operating electrical systems.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n          Required Skills and Competencies\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Extensive experience gained in Engineering and Operational experience, preferably in mega combined cycle power plant or energy sector projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will ideally have an Electrical Engineering degree or have the equivalent trade experience.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experience in working with Power Generation plant including boiler, steam turbine and associated utilities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Current HV Switching Operation license.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   #LI-MD2\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <i> ACCIONA has been given the Top Employer 2022 certification in Australia, which certifies the company's commitment to excellence in human resources management and those who focus on putting their people first through their exceptional HR policies. By greening Queensland's electricity mix, the MacIntyre wind complex will help the state meet its decarbonisation commitments and climate change mitigation strategies.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The project involves the design and construction of over 2.5 million cubic metres of bulk earthworks and civil works to create over 220 Km’s of roadways and access tracks to 182 turbine locations. The project scope also includes construction of 182 concrete foundations, and electrical reticulation for the site, including the construction of 3 substations and other operational facilities. The scale of the MacIntyre project makes it one of the largest wind farms in Australia.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   ACCIONA are seeking a Project Engineer for our Macintyre Windfarm project in QLD. Reporting to the Senior Project Engineer, this role is responsible for ensuring the effective coordination and control of Engineering Works for a designated Project through activities of technical, engineering, inspection, scheduling, planning, survey, procurement and quality control based on ACCIONA standards. The Project Engineer is responsible in assisting the Senior Project Engineer to ensure the safe and successful completion of the project on schedule, within budget and to the specified quality.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> This position can either be local to Warwick, QLD or drive in, drive out on a 10\u002F4 roster.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Key The project scope also includes construction of 182 concrete foundations, and electrical reticulation for the site, including the construction of 3 substations and other operational facilities.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   ACCIONA are seeking to engage a Survey Manager for our Macintyre Windfarm project in QLD. This position can either be local to Warwick, QLD or drive in, drive out on a 10\u002F4 roster. Reporting to the Construction Manager, you’ll join a collaborative team and will be responsible for leading the Survey team to deliver all survey works in a manner that enables the construction of the project to be done within the design specification.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Key accountabilities include, but are not limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Understanding the <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. With more than 30 years of experience and operations in 20 countries on five continents, ACCIONA Energía offers a wide portfolio of tailored energy solutions so that its corporate and institutional clients can meet their decarbonisation goals. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> Our business is expanding and as a result, an opportunity has opened up within our Brisbane Office for a Connections Manager who focus their attention on QLD. projects in the specified region.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         <div>\n          <div>\n           <div>\n <div>\n  ACCIONA Energía is the biggest 100% renewable energy company with no fossil legacy in the world. This includes the development, engineering, construction, operation and maintenance of renewable power plants -mainly wind and photovoltaic technologies-, energy sales and management and marketing, energy services, self-consumption, electric mobility and new technologies such as storage and green hydrogen. ACCIONA Energía is governed by the most demanding environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) criteria.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv> ACCIONA Energia is growing rapidly and an opportunity has opened up within the Melbourne Engineering team for an experienced Civil Engineer Manager. This role will lead all civil and structural engineering aspects for Australian projects and provide support to construction activities for wind and solar farm Balance of Plant infrastructure.\n <br> \n <br> Reporting to the Engineering Manager, this role is primarily office based in Melbourne with occasional travel to construction and development sites.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n procedures<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Development Projects\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Project concept phase feasibility assessments, design optioneering studies, value engineering and construction methodology, risks, safety (including Safety in Design) and costs assessments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of concept and detailed design delivery for civil and structural infrastructure for primarily wind farms, solar farms and BESS projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead development project constructability reviews including site based and desktop assessments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring team’s compliant review (and in some cases formal approval), of civil and structural designs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Scoping and project management of geotechnical investigation activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support project CAPEX and construction schedule development required for project financial investment decisions<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Construction Projects\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Perform engineering due diligence reviews and design management for design works outsourced to external consultants\u002Fcontractors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop contract technical specifications and scopes of work and assist with the negotiation of procurement agreements for civil design and construction work.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide support to the Project Delivery Teams through the construction and handover phases. Support requirements include responding to construction RFIs, resolution of design implementation issues. Occasional site visit will be required.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Operations\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide technical advice on civil engineering failures or
